docs.title: 🍽️ Welcome to the Collaborative Cookbook!
docs.text: A community-driven collection of recipes from around the world — built by contributors like you.

docs.title: ✨ Want to Contribute?
docs.text: Add your own recipe via Pull Request!

docs.title: Brownies
docs.text:
• Cuisine: American
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1/3 cup cocoa powder
  • 1/2 cup flour
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 1/4 cup chocolate chips (optional)
  • Steps:
  • Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease an 8x8 inch pan.
  • Melt butter, mix with sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
  • Sift in cocoa, flour, and salt. Mix until smooth.
  • Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into pan.
  • Bake 25–30 mins. Cool before cutting into squares.
  • Cooking Time: 45 mins (including prep & baking)

docs.title: Gulab Jamun
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1 cup milk powder
  • 2 tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
  • 1–2 tbsp milk (to bind)
  • Oil for frying
  • For sugar syrup:
    • 1 cup sugar
    • 1 cup water
    • 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
    • 1–2 drops rose water (optional)
  • Steps:
  • Mix milk powder, flour, cardamom. Add milk gradually to form a soft dough.
  • Shape into small balls (no cracks).
  • Heat oil on low-medium flame. Fry balls until deep golden brown.
  • Meanwhile, boil sugar + water + cardamom + rose water for 5–7 mins to make syrup.
  • Soak fried balls in hot syrup for 15–20 mins. Serve warm or chilled.
  • Cooking Time: 45 mins

docs.title: Rabdi
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1 liter full cream milk
  • 1/2 cup sugar
  • 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
  • 1/4 cup chopped nuts (pistachios, almonds)
  • Saffron strands (optional)
  • Steps:
  • Boil milk in a wide pan on medium heat, stirring often.
  • After 20–25 mins, milk will thicken. Add sugar and stir until dissolved.
  • Reduce heat, continue simmering for 30–40 mins until creamy and reduced.
  • Add cardamom, saffron, and nuts. Stir gently.
  • Cool and refrigerate. Serve chilled.
  • Cooking Time: 1 hr 15 mins

docs.title: Rasmalai
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1 liter full cream milk
  • 2 tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1/2 cup water
  • 1/2 cup thickened milk (malai) or heavy cream
  • 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
  • Saffron strands (optional)
  • Pistachios for garnish
  • Steps:
  • Boil milk until it reduces slightly. Add lemon juice to curdle.
  • Strain through muslin cloth. Rinse paneer under cold water to remove sourness.
  • Knead paneer until smooth. Form small flat discs.
  • Boil sugar + water to make syrup. Add paneer discs and simmer 10–15 mins.
  • Remove discs, cool. Soak in chilled malai + cardamom + saffron.
  • Garnish with pistachios. Serve chilled.
  • Cooking Time: 1 hr 30 mins

docs.title: Chole Bhature
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1 cup chickpeas (soaked overnight)
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 tsp coriander powder
  • 1/2 tsp garam masala
  • Salt to taste
  • Oil for cooking
  • 4 bhaturas (or naan/bread)
  • Steps:
  • Pressure cook soaked chickpeas until soft.
  • Heat oil, add cumin seeds, then sauté onions till golden.
  • Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook until oil separates.
  • Add cooked chickpeas, coriander powder, garam masala, salt. Simmer 10 mins.
  • Serve hot with warm bhaturas.
  • Cooking Time: 1 hr (includes soaking & cooking)

docs.title: Chole Kulche
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1 cup chickpeas (soaked overnight)
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 tsp coriander powder
  • 1/2 tsp garam masala
  • Salt to taste
  • Oil for cooking
  • 4 kulchas (or naan/bread)
  • Onion slices, lemon wedges, green chutney for serving
  • Steps:
  • Pressure cook soaked chickpeas with water until soft (about 3 whistles).
  • Heat oil, add cumin seeds, then sauté onions till golden.
  • Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook until oil separates.
  • Add cooked chickpeas, coriander powder, garam masala, salt. Simmer 10 mins.
  • Serve hot with warm kulchas, onion slices, and chutney.
  • Cooking Time: 1 hr (includes soaking & cooking)

docs.title: Masala Bhat (Spiced Rice)
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 1 cup rice (cooked)
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 1 tsp mustard seeds
  • 1 tsp urad dal
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 1 tomato, chopped
  • 1 green chili, slit
  • 1/2 tsp turmeric
  • 1 tsp sambar powder
  • Salt to taste
  • Coriander leaves for garnish
  • Steps:
  • Heat oil, add mustard seeds and urad dal. Let them splutter.
  • Add onion, green chili, and sauté till golden.
  • Add tomato, turmeric, sambar powder, salt. Cook until mushy.
  • Add cooked rice and mix gently. Cook for 2–3 mins.
  • Garnish with coriander. Serve hot with papad or pickle.
  • Cooking Time: 20 mins

docs.title: Paneer Tikka
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 200g paneer, cubed
  • 1 tbsp yogurt
  • 1 tsp garam masala
  • 1/2 tsp turmeric
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • Salt to taste
  • 1 tbsp oil (for grilling)
  • Steps:
  • In a bowl, mix yogurt, garam masala, turmeric, lemon juice, and salt.
  • Add paneer cubes and marinate for 30 minutes.
  • Skewer the paneer (optional) and grill or bake at 200°C for 15–20 minutes until golden.
  • Serve hot with mint chutney.
  • Cooking Time: 45 mins (including marination)

docs.title: Pav Bhaji
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 2 potatoes, boiled & mashed
  • 1 carrot, finely chopped
  • 1 capsicum, finely chopped
  • 1 tomato, chopped
  • 1 onion, finely chopped
  • 1 tbsp pav bhaji masala
  • 1 tsp butter
  • Salt to taste
  • 4 pav (bread rolls)
  • Chopped onions, coriander, lemon wedges for garnish
  • Steps:
  • Heat butter in a pan, sauté onions till golden.
  • Add carrots, capsicum, tomatoes, and cook until soft.
  • Add potatoes, salt, and pav bhaji masala. Mash everything together.
  • Simmer for 5–7 mins. Adjust consistency with water if needed.
  • Toast pav lightly in butter. Serve hot with bhaji, garnished with onions, coriander, and lemon.
  • Cooking Time: 30 mins

docs.title: Tandoori Chaap (Vegetarian)
docs.text:
• Cuisine: Indian
  • Author: @harshi2410
  • Ingredients:
  • 4 pieces soy chaap (frozen or fresh, thawed if frozen)
  • 1/2 cup yogurt (or dairy-free yogurt for vegan option)
  • 1 tbsp tandoori masala
  • 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
  • 1/2 tsp red chili powder (adjust to taste)
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • Salt to taste
  • 1 tbsp oil (for grilling or baking)
  • Steps:
  • If using frozen soy chaap, boil in water for 5–7 minutes until soft, then drain and pat dry.
  • In a bowl, mix yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, lemon juice, salt, and oil.
  • Add the soy chaap pieces and coat well. Marinate for at least 1 hour (or up to 4 hours for deeper flavor).
  • Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F). Place chaap on a greased tray.
  • Bake for 20–25 minutes, turning halfway, until slightly charred and aromatic.
    • Alternatively, grill on a stovetop tawa or barbecue for a smoky flavor.
  • Garnish with lemon wedges and serve hot with sliced onions and mint chutney.
  • Cooking Time: 1 hr 30 mins (including marination and prep)
